title: How to Make an Ulama Hoop Model

steps.headline: Take a plain, rectangular bar of soap.
steps.description: Take a pencil and outline two parallel lines running vertically from the bottom center. Stop at the middle.

steps.headline: Outline a circle where the lines stopped.
steps.description: Make sure it is perfectly round.

steps.headline: Take a butter knife, and start shaving away at the soap outside the outlined area.
Place the tip of the butter knife at the center of the circle.
steps.description: Slowly, carefully, begin spinning the knife to drill through the circle to make a hole.

steps.headline: Collect the shavings.
steps.description: Put them aside, and get out some paint. One a shade of brown, the other either red or yellow (preferably red).

steps.headline: Paint the soap brown.
steps.description: Let it dry once you have covered all of it.

steps.headline: Take the metal end of a paperclip.
steps.description: Dip it in the other paint and draw on Aztec symbols on both sides.

steps.headline: Get out a glass bowl.
steps.description: Fill it with hot water. Gather the shavings and place them in.

steps.headline: Wait for about 5 minutes.
steps.description: Carefully drain the water, and pick up the wet shavings.

steps.headline: Mold them together.
steps.description: Make a ball out of them. Try fitting it through the hoop, then let it dry once it fits.

steps.headline: Paint the ball brown, and let it dry.

Dip it in the other paint and draw on Aztec symbols on both sides. Get out a glass bowl. Fill it with hot water. Gather the shavings and place them in. Wait for about 5 minutes. Carefully drain the water, and pick up the wet shavings. Mold them together. Make a ball out of them. Try fitting it through the hoop, then let it dry once it fits. Paint the ball brown, and let it dry.
